newsitem.title: CANADA: Morrison Pete to buy Alberta gas plant.
newsitem.headline: Morrison Pete to buy Alberta gas plant.

text.p: Morrison Petroleums Ltd said on Wednesday it would purchase the Nevis gas plant in central Alberta from affiliate Canadian Gas Gathering Systems for C$120 million.
Morrison, which currently manages the 125 million cubic feet per day plant on behalf of CGGS, said it was pursuing the possibility of establishing a income trust that would acquire the plant.
Initial financing for the purchase was expected to come from Morrison's banking facility.
The Nevis plant, located 40 miles east of Red Deer, Alberta, processes sour and sweet gas into residue gas, propane, butane, condensate and sulphur.
The plant draws production from 11 producing areas through a 220-mile gathering system and is the only major sour gas processing plant within a 47-mile radius.
